title: crimedatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime Datasets
text: crimedatasets package provides comprehensive collection datasets focusing exclusively crimes, criminal activities, related socio-economic factors. package essential resource researchers, analysts, students working criminology, socio-economic studies, crime analysis. datasets included crimedatasets package sourced various established crime public data repositories, ensuring authenticity reliability data.

title: crimedatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime Datasets
text: datasets crimedatasets package distinguished suffixes specify type format data. suffixes include: tbl_df: tibble data frame df: standard data frame ts: time series object sf: spatial object (simple features)

title: crimedatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime Datasets
text: examples datasets included crimedatasets package: Abilene_tbl_df: Crime records Abilene, Texas, USA (Tabular Data). Attorney_tbl_df: Convictions reported U.S. Attorney’s Offices (Tabular Data). wmurders_ts: Annual female murder rate USA 1950-2004 (Time-series Data).

title: crimedatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime Datasets
text: examples create visualizations using datasets crimedatasets package.

title: crimedatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime Datasets
code: # Bar Chart with Abilene_tbl_df data set  Abilene_tbl_df %>%   ggplot(aes(x = factor(year), y = number, fill = crimetype)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +   labs(title = "Number of Violent Crimes by Year in Abilene, Texas",        x = "Year",        y = "Number of Violent Crimes") +   theme_minimal()

title: crimedatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime Datasets
code: # Convert the ts object into a data.frame wmurders_df <- data.frame(   year = as.numeric(time(wmurders_ts)), # Extract the time values as numeric   murder_rate = as.numeric(wmurders_ts) # Convert ts values to numeric )  # Plot using ggplot2 ggplot(wmurders_df, aes(x = year, y = murder_rate)) +   geom_line(color = "red") +   labs(     title = "Annual Female Murder Rate in the USA (1950-2004)",     x = "Year",     y = "Murder Rate per 100,000 Women"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: crimedatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime Datasets
text: crimedatasets package provides valuable extensive collection crime-related datasets, empowering researchers, analysts, students explore analyze various aspects criminal behavior socio-economic factors. offering datasets diverse formats (e.g., tbl_df, df, ts, sf), package ensures compatibility wide range analytical tools methodologies. examples visualizations vignette, demonstrated explore gain insights datasets using popular R packages like dplyr ggplot2. Whether investigating historical trends, studying regional crime patterns, analyzing socio-economic correlations, crimedatasets serves comprehensive resource analytical needs. encourage users explore full range datasets provided crimedatasets leverage advance research criminology, policy-making, data-driven decision-making.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Renzo Caceres Rossi. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rossi RC (2024). crimedatasets: Comprehensive Collection Crime-Related Datasets. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/lightbluetitan/crimedatasets.

title: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime-Related Datasets
text: crimedatasets package provides comprehensive collection datasets exclusively focused crimes, criminal activities, related topics. package serves valuable resource researchers, analysts, students interested crime analysis, criminology, socio-economic studies related criminal behavior. datasets included span global local contexts, offering tabular spatial data. dataset named suffix indicating structure type, making easier identify work data.

title: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime-Related Datasets
text: installation, can load package begin exploring datasets. consistent naming convention helps easily understand structure dataset: _tbl_df: Tibble. _table: Table. _sf: Simple Features (spatial data). _ts: Time series.

title: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime-Related Datasets
code: # Load the package library(crimedatasets)  # Load a dataset data("Abilene_tbl_df")  # View the dataset head(Abilene_tbl_df)  # Load another dataset data("nz_murders_sf")  # Summary of the spatial dataset summary(nz_murders_sf)

title: A Comprehensive Collection of Crime-Related Datasets
text: example datasets included crimedatasets package: Abilene_tbl_df: Crime Records Abilene, Texas, USA (_tbl_df tibble). CyberSecurityBreaches_df: Cybersecurity Breaches Reported US Health Department (_df data frame). TerrorismGlobal_table: Global Terrorism Database (GTD) Yearly Summaries (_table tabular data). nz_murders_sf: Murders New Zealand (2004 - 2019) (_sf spatial data). wmurders_ts: Annual Female Murder Rate USA (1950-2004) (_ts time series).

what: Cybersecurity Breaches Reported to US Health Department — CyberSecurityBreaches_df
title: Cybersecurity Breaches Reported to US Health Department — CyberSecurityBreaches_df
text: dataset contains records cybersecurity breaches reported US Department Health Human Services (HHS). Since October 2009, organizations United States store data human health required report incidents compromising confidentiality 500 patients human subjects (45 C.F.R. 164.408). reports publicly available provide detailed information affected entities, breach types, impacted individuals.

title: Cybersecurity Breaches Reported to US Health Department — CyberSecurityBreaches_df
Cybersecurity Breaches Reported to US Health Department — CyberSecurityBreaches_df
text: data frame 1,151 observations 9 variables: Name..Covered.Entity Name covered entity involved breach (character). State US state entity located (factor 52 levels). Covered.Entity.Type Type covered entity (factor 4 levels). Individuals.Affected Number individuals affected breach (integer). Breach.Submission.Date Date breach reported (Date). Type..Breach Type breach (factor 29 levels). Location..Breached.Information Location breached information (factor 47 levels). Business.Associate.Present Indicates whether business associate involved (logical). Web.Description Description breach provided online (character).
